channel.title: Wordpress on SpiderSoft
channel.description: Recent content in Wordpress on SpiderSoft

item.title: Setting up caddy server for wordpress
item.description: Caddy is a another alternative to Apache or nginx . For me the biggest advantage is that it’s only one binary file to work with. It’s easy to run, setup and just “works”. It’s super modern – handles HTTP2 and automatic HTTPS encryption using let’s encrypt certificates. Obviously it has plenty of other features but we focus only on speed of deployment.

item.title: How to force jQuery version on WordPress
item.description: Another really simple code snippet. This time, we are trying to force particular version of jQuery injecting into WordPress.
